data.title: Fresh Air "Progressive Radio" June 22, 1978 on WKSU-FM Kent State University with Paul Ciminero
meta_keywords: 1978 on WKSU-FM Kent State University with Paul Ciminero
data.meta_description:
On this special Podcast today, you'll hear another two hour segment from the groundbreaking Progressive/alternative college radio program, FRESH AIR, captured on cassette tape on June 22, 1978.  I was a host on WKSU-FM's "Fresh Air," the late night, student run program during the heyday of Northeastern Ohio's prevalence in rock and alternative musics in the 1970's and 80's.  Today's archival tape, restored and remastered by Dr. Woo,(a former Program Director of the show) is one of over 200 hours of tapes of this legendary program which aired from 1973 until 1981.  

Fresh Air was coming into it's own by the date of this tape, having recently moved from a midnight to 3 AM time slot to a 11PM to 6 AM spot almost every night. The program had debuted an "Artist of the Week" feature to better educate the audience (and the DJ's as well) as to the styles of music we were playing back then.  Artists like Brian Eno, Peter Hammill, Gong, and John Martyn were among those featured.

The show had begun printing it's bi-monthly "Fresh Air Program Guide" at the time and distributing it in record stores all over Northern Ohio. We had also added a weekly "Import Album Premiere" every Saturday night and had begun an interview/music program called the "Industrial Wasteland" with  many of the artists we played.  Fresh Air and WKSU also began co-sponsoring concerts with Kent State's "All Campus Programming Board" and other outside venues.  

To hear more of this groundbreaking program and it's innovative style of free form, progressive radio and the numerous interviews with those performers we played go to the link provided below:
http://xerographicoppossum.blogspot.com/

Here then, is the playlist from Fresh Air on June 22, 1978:

SET #1:  
DAVID GILMOUR-"No Way"-1st Solo LP/
JEFF WAYNE/Various Artists- "Horsell Common and the Heat Ray (Part 1)- War of the Worlds/
ROY BUCHANAN-"You're Not Alone"-You're Not Alone/
JEFF WAYNE-"Horsell Common and the Heat Ray (Part 2)-War of the Worlds/

SET 2:  
JIMI HENDRIX-"Are You Experienced?"/
STOMU YAMASHTA - "Surfspin-Time is Here"- Go Live in Paris/
THE DOORS-" Not to Touch the Earth"- Waiting for the Sun/
TIN HUEY-"Puppet Wipes"-(EP)/
PERE UBU-"Cloud"- Datapanik in the Year Zero(EP)/
SYD BARRETT-"Baby Lemonade"-BARRETT

SET #3:  
EGG-"Ennaegram"-Civil Service/
JUKKA TOLONEN-"Witch Drum"-Cross Section/
ALAN PARSONS PROJECT-"Voyager & What Goes Up"- Pyramid/
THE STRAWBS-"Ghosts"-Ghosts/
FAR EAST FAMILY BAND-"Timeless Phase"-Tenjukin/

SET #4:  
FRANK ZAPPA-"Big Leg Emma"-Zappa in New York/
KEN NORDINE-"The Videot"-How Are Things in Your Town?/
JOE BYRD-"American Way of Love"- The United States of America"/
TANGERINE DREAM-Part 1"- Phaedra/
TOM GLASER & DOTTIE EVANS-"Zoom a Little Zoom Rocket Ship"-Space Songs 
(**played in the middle of the Phaedra Part 1 cut)
TANGERINE DREAM-"Part 2"-Phaedra
